item.title: 奇货通讯：分散也是信贷市场的一个故事
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: Alvean 和 Raizen 在大型交易所交割中获得白糖
item.description: 大宗商品贸易商 Alvean Sugar SL 和巴西最大的生产商 Raizen SA 将大部分原糖用于交割即将到期的纽约期货，这是多年来这一时期最大的一次交割。【原文：Commodities trader Alvean Sugar SL and top Brazilian producer Raizen SA took most of the raw sugar to settle expiring New York futures in the largest delivery for this time of year in years.】

item.title: 西班牙 Europastry 公司以法国大选为由搁置 IPO 计划
item.description: 西班牙烘焙公司 Europastry SA 推迟了首次公开募股，成为在该地区首次公开募股复苏乏力的情况下，最新一家停止上市计划的欧洲公司。【原文：Spanish bakery firm Europastry SA postponed its initial public offering, becoming the latest European firm to halt listing plans amid the region’s faltering IPO revival.】

item.title: Rite Aid 避免全面关闭，重组计划获批
item.description: Rite Aid 公司的重组计划获得法院批准后，已获准退出破产程序，该计划准备通过将业务控制权交给主要债权人，使这家濒临破产的连锁药店免于清算。【原文：Rite Aid Corp. has been cleared to exit bankruptcy after winning court approval on a restructuring plan that’s poised to save the ailing pharmacy chain from liquidation by handing control of the business to key creditors.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚中央银行无视石油价格，将利率降至 11.25
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行周五将基准利率下调半个百分点至 11.25%，顶住了政府要求其加快货币宽松步伐以重振经济增长的压力。【原文：Colombia’s central bank cut its benchmark interest by half a percentage point to 11.25% on Friday, defying government pressure to accelerate the pace of monetary easing to revive economic growth.】

item.title: 债券有望在 12 月以来最好的月份超越国债
item.description: 本月市政债券市场的表现有望略微超过国债，这主要得益于固定收益市场的广泛反弹，以及美国各州和城市债务的典型强势期。【原文：The municipal-bond market is on track to slightly outpace Treasuries this month, benefiting from a broad fixed-income rally and a period that is typically strong for US state and city debt.】

item.title: 季度末融资市场 "沉睡 "的日子一去不复返了
item.description: 回购协议市场利率的波动表明，今年早些时候出现的融资成本崩溃已经结束。【原文：The whipsawing of rates in the market for repurchase agreements suggests that the collapse in funding costs seen earlier in the year has come to an end.】

item.title: 花旗集团要求驳回前合规员工的报复诉讼
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）要求法院驳回一名前高级数据合规官员的诉讼，该官员指控花旗集团解雇了她，因为她拒绝在银行数据管理实践方面误导监管机构。【原文：Citigroup Inc. asked a court to dismiss a lawsuit by a former senior data compliance official who accused it of firing her for refusing to mislead a regulator about the bank’s data governance practices.】

item.title: Blackstone 的 Zawadzki 认为私人信贷市场规模达 25 万亿美元
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone Inc.【原文：The $1.7 trillion private-lending industry is still “in batting practice” before it swells to a $25 trillion market, according to one of its powerhouses, Blackstone Inc.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚 Ecopetrol 石油公司正与贸易商洽谈购买液化天然气事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着哥伦比亚国内天然气产量的减少，哥伦比亚国有能源公司 Ecopetrol SA 正在与液化天然气供应商进行谈判。【原文：Colombia’s state energy company Ecopetrol SA is in talks with suppliers of liquefied natural gas as the nation’s domestic gas production dwindles, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 生物制药公司 Alumis 首次公开募股规模缩小后股价下跌 20
item.description: Alumis Inc. 是一家处于临床阶段的生物制药公司，该公司在首次公开募股中募集了 2.5 亿美元，同时还进行了私募，上市后股价下跌了 20%。【原文：Shares of Alumis Inc. sank 20% in the clinical stage biopharmaceutical company’s public debut, after it raised $250 million in a downsized initial public offering with a concurrent private placement.】

item.title: 马拉松公司首席执行官称，私人信贷激增可能达到 15 万亿美元
item.description: 布鲁斯-理查兹（Bruce Richards）说，私人信贷市场已经是增长最快的市场之一，随着借贷类型的扩大和扩展，未来十年私人信贷市场将从目前的 1.7 万亿美元膨胀到 15 万亿美元。【原文：The private-credit universe — already one of the fastest-growing markets — has room to balloon to $15 trillion over the next decade from $1.7 trillion today as types of lending broaden and expand, said Bruce Richards, whose Marathon Asset Management invests in a multitude of credit markets.】

item.title: 彭博社法国民意调查：勒庞集团扩大领先优势
item.description: 根据彭博社的民意调查，玛丽娜-勒庞领导的极右翼国民公署在周日举行的法国临时立法选举第一轮投票前巩固了其领先地位。【原文：Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has cemented its lead ahead of the first round of France’s snap legislative election on Sunday, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.】

item.title: 最新数据加剧预算忧虑，巴西市场一片哗然
item.description: 由于有关巴西预算赤字的新数据加剧了人们对总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）加强财政账户的承诺的担忧，巴西市场周五再次遭受损失。【原文：Brazilian markets suffered additional losses Friday as fresh data on the country’s budget deficit fueled concerns about President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s commitment to shoring up its fiscal accounts.】

item.title: 俄罗斯可能恢复生产中程导弹
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）表示，俄罗斯很可能恢复中短程导弹的生产，这是对美国在世界各地部署核能力武器的回应。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin signaled his country is likely to resume the production of short and intermediate-range missiles in what he called a response to the US deployment of the nuclear-capable weapons in various regions of the world.】

item.title: 私募股权投资 300 亿美元周为并购复苏带来希望
item.description: 本周，私募股权公司在全球范围内达成了 300 多亿美元的交易，为今年上半年并购活动的缓慢复苏带来了希望。【原文：Private equity firms clinched more than $30 billion of deals around the world this week, raising hopes for a recovery in mergers and acquisitions following a slow first half of the year.】

item.title: 象牙海岸预计下季可可产量将因天气好转而反弹
item.description: 象牙海岸的可可产量有望在下一季反弹，这将有助于缓解全球供应紧张的局面，可可价格也将突破历史最高纪录。【原文：Ivory Coast’s cocoa output is expected to rebound next season — helping ease a global supply squeeze that pushed prices past records — as the world’s top grower banks on better weather.】

item.title: 赞比亚克瓦查汇率在削减本地贸易中美元份额的行动中跳涨
item.description: 赞比亚的克瓦查汇率创下四个月来的最大涨幅，因为该国计划出台限制在当地经济中使用外币的法规，以对抗通货膨胀。【原文：Zambia’s kwacha jumped the most in four months amid plans to introduce regulations restricting the use of foreign currency in the local economy aimed at fighting inflation.】

item.title: Astorg 聘请 Evercore 探讨股权和债务融资方案
item.description: Astorg 是一家管理着 220 亿欧元（240 亿美元）资产的私募股权公司，在该公司准备迎接领导层换代之际，正与 Evercore Inc.【原文：Astorg, a private equity firm that manages €22 billion ($24 billion) in assets, is working with Evercore Inc. to explore various financing options as the company prepares for a generational change among its leadership.】

item.title: 华尔街的基本规则受到最高法院裁决的威胁
item.description: 最高法院削弱了一项已有数十年历史的法律原则，该原则赋予联邦机构解释法律的广泛余地，在此之后，华尔街有望在与美国证券交易委员会的斗争中赢得更多胜利。【原文：Wall Street is poised to win more battles with the US Securities and Exchange Commission after the Supreme Court weakened a decades-old legal doctrine that gave federal agencies expansive leeway to interpret the law.】

item.description: 就在下个月第二季度财报季正式开始之前，消费类股票本周的惨淡表现引发了人们对美国家庭财务健康状况的担忧。【原文：A dismal week for consumer stocks is raising concern about the financial health of US households just before the second-quarter earnings season begins in earnest next month.】

item.description: 交易商们抱怨本周德国电力市场出现的信息技术故障造成了不公平的损失。【原文：Traders are complaining about unfair losses made in the German power market because of an IT glitch this week.】

item.title: 中国吉利确认沙特阿美将购买雷诺合资公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）将在与法国雷诺汽车公司（Renault SA）和中国浙江吉利控股集团有限公司（Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co.【原文：Saudi Aramco will take a 10% stake in an automotive joint venture with France’s Renault SA and China’s Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co., a smaller commitment than originally signaled by the world’s biggest oil company.】

item.title: 智利经济出现复苏迹象，铜供应得到提振
item.description: 智利是世界上最大的电线金属铜供应国，其铜产量正显示出从 20 年低点回升的迹象。【原文：Copper production in Chile, the world’s biggest supplier of the wiring metal, is showing signs of recovering from 20-year lows.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿加瓦尔将重新控制赞比亚铜矿
item.description: 韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd.）即将夺回赞比亚孔科拉铜矿的控制权，并计划迅速提高产量，因为预计未来几年需求将激增。【原文：Vedanta Resources Ltd. is close to taking back control of the Konkola copper mine in Zambia and plans to quickly ramp up output as demand is expected to surge in the coming years.】

item.title: 资金枯竭，佩特罗佩罗寻求政府提供新的贷款减免
item.description: 秘鲁陷入困境的国有石油公司要求政府将其部分贷款转为股权，并推迟最后期限，以避免今年出现资金短缺。【原文：Peru’s struggling state-owned oil company is asking the government to convert some of its loans into equity and push back deadlines to avoid running out of cash this year.】
